posts.post_content: @Londemonium - Wrath of God is one of the few things this won't help against unfortunately. Let's say your opponent casts WoG, and you cast this in response to save a creature. Your creature disappears, fizzling any spells targetting it like [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt), then reappears. Then WoG resolves and kills everything.
posts.html:

Posted By: Cheezinator (8/10/2011 6:40:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is a combo with creatures with enters-the-battlefield effects such as **[Viridian Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viridian Shaman)**, leaves-the-battlefield effects such as **[Phyrexian Bloodstock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Bloodstock)**, creatures with vanishing such as **[Waning Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Waning Wurm)**, creatures with evoke such as **[Shriekmaw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shriekmaw)**, creatures with unearth such as **[Hell's Thunder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hell's Thunder)**, creatures with morph such as [Krosan Cloudscraper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krosan Cloudscraper) (yes, this does cause a face-down creature to be flipped face-up), noncreatures with morph such as [Zoetic Cavern](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zoetic Cavern), creatures with echo such as **[Goblin Patrol](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Patrol)** (for whatever reason you'd want to pay the echo cost a second time), and for purposes of blocking and fizzling spells every other targetable creature in the game.
posts.html:
This card is a combo with creatures with enters-the-battlefield effects such as Viridian Shaman, leaves-the-battlefield effects such as Phyrexian Bloodstock, creatures with vanishing such as Waning Wurm, creatures with evoke such as Shriekmaw, creatures with unearth such as Hell's Thunder, creatures with morph such as Krosan Cloudscraper (yes, this does cause a face-down creature to be flipped face-up), noncreatures with morph such as Zoetic Cavern, creatures with echo such as Goblin Patrol (for whatever reason you'd want to pay the echo cost a second time), and for purposes of blocking and fizzling spells every other targetable creature in the game.

posts.post_content: I wondered why tokens couldn't come back to the battlefield with this card. I knew tokens cease existing outside the battlefield because of rule 704.5d. But that is a state-based action, and SBA's aren't checked during the resolution of an ability. But for those wanting to know, the rule that applies to this card for tokens is 110.5g.
posts.html:
I wondered why tokens couldn't come back to the battlefield with this card. I knew tokens cease existing outside the battlefield because of rule 704.5d. But that is a state-based action, and SBA's aren't checked during the resolution of an ability. But for those wanting to know, the rule that applies to this card for tokens is 110.5g.

posts.post_content: The Blink is a classic Johnny card that doesn't require a full Johnny to utilize it. Amazing synergy with any "Enters the battlefield..." effects and effectively a counterspell against a spell targeting your creature. But best white instant ever? I think not: [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares), [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile), and [Unmake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unmake) are just more ubiquitously useful.
posts.html:
The Blink is a classic Johnny card that doesn't require a full Johnny to utilize it. Amazing synergy with any "Enters the battlefield..." effects and effectively a counterspell against a spell targeting your creature. But best white instant ever? I think not: Swords to Plowshares, Path to Exile, and Unmake are just more ubiquitously useful.

posts.post_content: Its casting cost contains only white mana, therefore it's a white card, and when it's on the stack it's a white spell. It's just a white spell that happens to have an ability that uses blue mana.
